title: Authors and Citation
text: Salim Brüggemann. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Brüggemann S (2024). gitlab: Use GitLab's v4 RESTful API. R package version 0.0.9000, https://gitlab.com/rpkg.dev/gitlab, https://gitlab.rpkg.dev.
code: @Manual{,   title = {gitlab: Use GitLab's v4 RESTful API},   author = {Salim Brüggemann},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.9000, https://gitlab.com/rpkg.dev/gitlab},   url = {https://gitlab.rpkg.dev}, }

title: Use GitLab's v4 RESTful API
text: Allows conveniently work GitLab’s v4 RESTful API R. GitLab (https://gitlab.com) open-source DevOps software suite .. includes powerful Git forge.

title: Use GitLab's v4 RESTful API
text: install latest development version gitlab, run following R:
code: if (!("remotes" %in% rownames(installed.packages()))) {   install.packages(pkgs = "remotes",                    repos = "https://cloud.r-project.org/") }  remotes::install_gitlab(repo = "rpkg.dev/gitlab")

title: Use GitLab's v4 RESTful API
text: (function) reference found .

title: Use GitLab's v4 RESTful API
text: gitlab’s functionality controlled via package-specific global configuration can either set via R options environment variables (former take precedence). configuration includes:

title: Use GitLab's v4 RESTful API
text: package’s source code written R Markdown file format facilitate practices commonly referred literate programming. allows actual code freely mixed explanatory supplementary information expressive Markdown format instead rely # comments . .gen.R suffixed R source code found R/ generated respective R Markdown counterparts Rmd/ using pkgpurl::purl_rmd()1. Always make changes .Rmd files – never .R files – run pkgpurl::purl_rmd() regenerate R source files.

title: Use GitLab's v4 RESTful API
text: package borrows lot Tidyverse design philosophies. R code adheres principles specified Tidyverse Design Guide wherever possible formatted according Tidyverse Style Guide (TSG) following exceptions: Line width limited 160 characters, double limit proposed TSG (80 characters ridiculously little given today’s high-resolution wide screen monitors). Furthermore, preferred style breaking long lines differs. Instead wrapping directly expression’s opening bracket suggested TSG, prefer two fewer line breaks indent subsequent lines within expression opening bracket: results less vertical horizontal spread code better readability pipes. Usage magrittr’s compound assignment pipe-operator %<>% desirable2. Usage R’s right-hand assignment operator -> allowed3. R source code split several files suggested TSG instead (far possible) kept single file Rmd/gitlab.Rmd well-structured thanks Markdown support. far possible, deviations TSG plus additional restrictions formally specified pkgpurl::default_linters, (default) used pkgpurl::lint_rmd(), turn recommended way lint package.
code: # TSG proposes this do_something_very_complicated(   something = "that",   requires = many,   arguments = "some of which may be long" )  # we prefer this do_something_very_complicated(something = "that",                               requires = many,                               arguments = "some of which may be long")

title: Create GitLab API request — api_req
text: Assembles HTTP request structure common GitLab v4 RESTful API requests performed package.

title: Create GitLab API request — api_req
code: api_req(   path,   method = c("GET", "CONNECT", "DELETE", "HEAD", "OPTIONS", "PATCH", "POST", "PUT",     "TRACE"),   url_params = NULL,   body_json = NULL,   auto_unbox = TRUE,   base_url = pal::pkg_config_val("base_url"),   token = pal::pkg_config_val("token"),   max_tries = 3L )

title: Create GitLab API request — api_req
text: path character(1) Path relative GitLab API base_url. method character(1)HTTP request method. One "GET", "CONNECT", "DELETE", "HEAD", "OPTIONS", "PATCH", "POST", "PUT" "TRACE". url_params list() URL parameters added query string. Either NULL omit named list key-value pairs define query parameters. Values must scalars. opt automatic conversion non-character values JSON strings percent-encoding values, wrap values (). body_json list() Data include JSON HTTP request body. NULL means empty body. auto_unbox logical(1) Whether automatically "unbox" length-1 vectors body_json JSON scalars. base_url character(1) Base URL GitLab v4 RESTful API root. token character(1)GitLab access token used authentication. NULL, API request made unauthenticated results HTTP 404 Found errors non-public resources. max_tries integer(1) Maximum number attempts retry case HTTP error.

title: Create GitLab API request — api_req
text: httr2::req_method return

title: Create GitLab API request — api_req
code: # let's call the `/metadata` endpoint (https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/api/metadata.html) gitlab::api_req(path = "/metadata",                 method = "GET") |>   httr2::req_perform() |>   httr2::resp_body_json() #> $version #> [1] "17.7.0-pre" #>  #> $revision #> [1] "fdcff1f8f32" #>  #> $kas #> $kas$enabled #> [1] TRUE #>  #> $kas$externalUrl #> [1] "wss://kas.gitlab.com" #>  #> $kas$externalK8sProxyUrl #> [1] "https://kas.gitlab.com/k8s-proxy" #>  #> $kas$version #> [1] "17.7.0+9fd3ef87a54f73b17bf775d30b2153e8b242cf1c" #>  #>  #> $enterprise #> [1] TRUE #>

title: Build GitLab repository URL — build_url
text: Assembles URL specified repository path GitLab's web interface.

title: Build GitLab repository URL — build_url
code: build_url(   id_proj,   ...,   ref = NULL,   force_branch_ref = FALSE,   base_url = pal::pkg_config_val("base_url"),   token = pal::pkg_config_val("token"),   max_tries = 3L )

title: Build GitLab repository URL — build_url
text: id_proj integer(1) GitLab project identifier. ... character() Optional path components added repository base URL. ref character(1)Git revision expression matching desired Git tree object, e.g. ref name (branch, tag, etc.), commit identifier, another symbolic reference like "HEAD~10". Note GitLab API support every type revision expression. Defaults "HEAD" NULL. force_branch_ref logical(1) Whether force ref interpreted branch name adding ref_type=heads URL parameter. base_url character(1) Base URL GitLab v4 RESTful API root. token character(1)GitLab access token used authentication. NULL, API request made unauthenticated results HTTP 404 Found errors non-public resources. max_tries integer(1) Maximum number attempts retry case HTTP error.

title: Build GitLab repository URL — build_url
text: character scalar.

title: Build GitLab repository URL — build_url
code: gitlab::build_url(id_proj = 64767928,                   "Rmd/gitlab.Rmd") #> [1] "https://gitlab.com/rpkg.dev/gitlab/-/tree/HEAD/Rmd/gitlab.Rmd"

what: List files and directories in GitLab repository — dir_ls
title: List files and directories in GitLab repository — dir_ls
text: Lists file directory names found specified path GitLab repository via GET /projects/:id/repository/tree endpoint GitLab's v4 RESTful API.

title: List files and directories in GitLab repository — dir_ls
code: dir_ls(   id_proj,   path = "",   recursive = FALSE,   ref = project_default_branch(id_proj = id_proj, base_url = base_url, token = token,     max_tries = max_tries),   base_url = pal::pkg_config_val("base_url"),   token = pal::pkg_config_val("token"),   max_tries = 3L )

title: List files and directories in GitLab repository — dir_ls
text: id_proj integer(1) GitLab project identifier. path character(1) Directory path, relative repository root. recursive logical(1) Whether recurse subdirectories path. ref character(1)Git revision expression matching desired Git tree object, e.g. ref name (branch, tag, etc.), commit identifier, another symbolic reference like "HEAD~10". Note GitLab API support every type revision expression. Defaults "HEAD" NULL. base_url character(1) Base URL GitLab v4 RESTful API root. token character(1)GitLab access token used authentication. NULL, API request made unauthenticated results HTTP 404 Found errors non-public resources. max_tries integer(1) Maximum number attempts retry case HTTP error.

title: List files and directories in GitLab repository — dir_ls
text: tibble.

title: List files and directories in GitLab repository — dir_ls

what: Read in file from GitLab repository — file_content
title: Read in file from GitLab repository — file_content
text: Downloads file GitLab repository via GET /projects/{id}/repository/files/{path}/raw endpoint GitLab's v4 RESTful API returns content.

title: Read in file from GitLab repository — file_content
code: file_content(   path,   id_proj,   ref = NULL,   base_url = pal::pkg_config_val("base_url"),   token = pal::pkg_config_val("token"),   max_tries = 3L )

title: Read in file from GitLab repository — file_content
text: path character(1) File path, relative repository root. id_proj integer(1) GitLab project identifier. ref character(1)Git revision expression matching desired Git tree object, e.g. ref name (branch, tag, etc.), commit identifier, another symbolic reference like "HEAD~10". Note GitLab API support every type revision expression. Defaults "HEAD" NULL. base_url character(1) Base URL GitLab v4 RESTful API root. token character(1)GitLab access token used authentication. NULL, API request made unauthenticated results HTTP 404 Found errors non-public resources. max_tries integer(1) Maximum number attempts retry case HTTP error.

title: Read in file from GitLab repository — file_content
text: character scalar path refers text file, otherwise raw vector.

title: Read in file from GitLab repository — file_content
code: gitlab::file_content(path = "DESCRIPTION",                      id_proj = 64767928) |>   cat() #> Package: gitlab #> Title: Use GitLab's v4 RESTful API #> Version: 0.0.9000 #> Authors@R:  #>     person("Salim", "Brüggemann", , "salim-b@pm.me", role = c("aut", "cre"), #>            comment = c(ORCID = "0000-0002-5329-5987")) #> Description: Allows to conveniently work with GitLab's v4 RESTful API from #>     R. GitLab (https://gitlab.com) is an open-source DevOps software suite #>     that i.a. includes a powerful Git forge. #> License: AGPL (>= 3) #> URL: https://gitlab.com/salim_b/r/pkgs/gitlab #> BugReports: https://gitlab.com/salim_b/r/pkgs/gitlab/issues #> Depends:  #>     R (>= 4.4) #> Imports:  #>     base64enc (>= 0.1.3), #>     brio (>= 1.1.5), #>     checkmate (>= 2.3.2), #>     cli (>= 3.6.3), #>     digest (>= 0.6.37), #>     fs (>= 1.6.5), #>     glue (>= 1.8.0), #>     heck (>= 0.1.3), #>     httr2 (>= 1.0.6), #>     jsonlite (>= 1.8.9), #>     magrittr (>= 2.0.3), #>     pal (>= 0.0.9101), #>     purrr (>= 1.0.2), #>     rlang (>= 1.1.4), #>     stringr (>= 1.5.1), #>     tibble (>= 3.2.1) #> Encoding: UTF-8 #> LazyData: true #> Roxygen: list(markdown = TRUE) #> RoxygenNote: 7.3.2.9000

what: Create file in GitLab repository — file_create
title: Create file in GitLab repository — file_create
text: Creates new file GitLab repository via POST /projects/{id}/repository/files/{path} endpoint GitLab's v4 RESTful API.

title: Create file in GitLab repository — file_create

title: Delete file from GitLab repository — file_delete

NULL means default token owner. author_name character(1) Git commit author's name. NULL means default token owner. last_commit_id character(1) Last known file commit identifier. provided (valid), GitLab write file commit made last_commit_id modified file. Intended avoid concurrency issues (e.g. CI pipelines). NULL means skip check. base_url character(1) Base URL GitLab v4 RESTful API root. token character(1)GitLab access token used authentication. NULL, API request made unauthenticated results HTTP 404 Found errors non-public resources. max_tries integer(1) Maximum number attempts retry case HTTP error.

title: Test if file exists in GitLab repository — file_exists
text: path character(1) File path, relative repository root. id_proj integer(1) GitLab project identifier. ref character(1)Git revision expression matching desired Git tree object, e.g. ref name (branch, tag, etc.), commit identifier, another symbolic reference like "HEAD~10". Note GitLab API support every type revision expression. Defaults "HEAD" NULL. base_url character(1) Base URL GitLab v4 RESTful API root. token character(1)GitLab access token used authentication. NULL, API request made unauthenticated results HTTP 404 Found errors non-public resources. max_tries integer(1) Maximum number attempts retry case HTTP error.

what: Create GitLab file management API request — file_req

text: Assembles HTTP request structure common GitLab v4 RESTful API requests manage files performed package.

title: Create GitLab file management API request — file_req
code: file_req(   method,   path,   id_proj,   ref = NULL,   body_json = NULL,   base_url = pal::pkg_config_val("base_url"),   token = pal::pkg_config_val("token"),   max_tries = 3L )

title: Create GitLab file management API request — file_req
text: method character(1)HTTP request method. One "GET", "CONNECT", "DELETE", "HEAD", "OPTIONS", "PATCH", "POST", "PUT" "TRACE". path character(1) File path, relative repository root. id_proj integer(1) GitLab project identifier. ref character(1)Git revision expression matching desired Git tree object, e.g. ref name (branch, tag, etc.), commit identifier, another symbolic reference like "HEAD~10". Note GitLab API support every type revision expression. Defaults "HEAD" NULL. body_json list() Data include JSON HTTP request body. NULL means empty body. base_url character(1) Base URL GitLab v4 RESTful API root. token character(1)GitLab access token used authentication. NULL, API request made unauthenticated results HTTP 404 Found errors non-public resources. max_tries integer(1) Maximum number attempts retry case HTTP error.

what: Write file to GitLab repository — file_write
title: Write file to GitLab repository — file_write
text: Uploads file GitLab repository via GitLab's v4 RESTful API. High-level function default skips uploading identical file content automatically choses file_create() file_update() based whether file already exists .

title: Write file to GitLab repository — file_write
code: file_write(   content,   path,   id_proj,   start_branch = project_default_branch(id_proj = id_proj, base_url = base_url, token =     token, max_tries = max_tries),   branch = start_branch,   from_file = FALSE,   overwrite = TRUE,   force = FALSE,   commit_message = "auto: write file via gitlab R pkg",   author_email = NULL,   author_name = NULL,   execute_filemode = FALSE,   last_commit_id = file_meta(path = path, attribute = "last_commit_id", id_proj =     id_proj, ref = branch, base_url = base_url, token = token, max_tries = max_tries),   base_url = pal::pkg_config_val("base_url"),   token = pal::pkg_config_val("token"),   max_tries = 3L,   quiet = FALSE )

title: Write file to GitLab repository — file_write
text: content character(1) raw() File content, character scalar text files, raw vector binary files. path local file character scalar from_file = TRUE. path character(1) File path, relative repository root. id_proj integer(1) GitLab project identifier. start_branch character(1) Name base branch create branch already exist. branch character(1) Git branch name upload file . from_file logical(1) Whether content indicates path local file instead actual file content. overwrite logical(1) Whether overwrite already existing file. Unless force = TRUE, file overwritten identical content. force logical(1) Whether overwrite already existing file even identical content. commit_message character(1) Git commit message. author_email character(1) Git commit author's email address. NULL means default token owner. author_name character(1) Git commit author's name. NULL means default token owner. execute_filemode logical(1) Whether mark uploaded file executable, last_commit_id character(1) Last known file commit identifier. provided (valid), GitLab write file commit made last_commit_id modified file. Intended avoid concurrency issues (e.g. CI pipelines). NULL means skip check. base_url character(1) Base URL GitLab v4 RESTful API root. token character(1)GitLab access token used authentication. NULL, API request made unauthenticated results HTTP 404 Found errors non-public resources. max_tries integer(1) Maximum number attempts retry case HTTP error. quiet logical(1) Whether suppress printing status output internal processing.

title: Write file to GitLab repository — file_write
text: path, invisibly.
